channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump's 2nd-term foreign policy includes power plays in Greenland, Panama and beyond
item.description: N.Y. Times journalist David Sanger says Trump's idea of America first is now less isolationism, more expansionism. He expects changes in the approach ...

item.title: Who qualifies for the IRS hardship program?
item.description: This program can pause IRS collection activities temporarily, but it won't be the right option for everyone.

item.title: Spain plans 100% tax for homes bought by non-EU residents
item.description: The measure is meant to help tackle the country's housing crisis, the prime minister said.

item.title: Watch Live: Pete Hegseth faces senators at confirmation hearing
item.description: Pete Hegseth, President-elect Donald Trump's embattled pick to lead the Defense Department, is facing senators at his confirmation hearing.

item.title: Five things we learn about Pope Francis from his new memoir
item.description: In Pope Francis' autobiography Hope he reiterates themes of his papacy like hatred of war and unchecked capitalism, and a desire for the Catholic Chur...

item.title: Dangerous winds could fuel blazes as Los Angeles beefs up firefighting force
Sudan shelling kills more than 100 civilians near capital
item.description: Rescuers say medical supplies are running low as health workers struggle to treat the victims.

item.title: Multiracial boom in 2020 census was mostly an illusion, researchers say
Relatives wait for news as body bags hauled from South African mine
item.description: Hundreds of people have reportedly been underground since a crackdown on illegal mining began last year.

item.title: Chemicals in sewage sludge fertilizer pose cancer risk, EPA says
item.description: Harmful chemicals in sewage sludge spread on pasture as fertilizer pose a risk to people who regularly consume milk, beef and other products from thos...

item.title: James Webb Space Telescope's "little red dots" come into focus
item.description: A cosmic object spotted by the James Webb Space Telescope has flummoxed astronomers. Now, a research team has studied hundreds of these "little red do...

item.title: Two passenger jets came dangerously to each other in the skies over Phoenix
item.description: The Federal Aviation Administration is once again looking into a close call at a major U.S. airport, after two passenger jets narrowly avoided a mid-a...

item.title: Sen. Warren grills Hegseth on past comments about women in combat
item.description: Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-Massachusetts) used Pete Hegseth's past comments to follow up on the former news anchor's position about women serving in com...

item.title: What we know about the Gaza ceasefire deal
item.description: What we know so far about the possible ceasefire deal being negotiated between Israel and Hamas.

item.title: Trump says he'll create "External Revenue Service" to collect tariffs
item.description: The federal government already collects tariffs, and deposits them in the General Fund of the United States.

item.title: Drugmakers hiked prices for hundreds of drugs in early January
item.description: January is a big time for drugmakers to hike prices. This year saw higher prices for 575 medications so far, including Ozempic, drugs for HIV, cancer ...

item.title: Composer Arnold Schoenberg's archive destroyed in LA fires
item.description: About 100,000 scores by the Austrian-American composer have been lost in the Pacific Palisade fires.

item.title: Princess Kate announces she's in remission from cancer
item.description: Princess Kate made the announcement on social media after visiting the London hospital where she received treatment.
